docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Howdy!

This is the documentation for getting Maudpack up and running.

This site serves as a reference to help you get started with running Maudpack, or realistically any Modrinth modpack for that matter.

I recommend following these pages in order:

  • Installation

  • Configuration

  • Tips and Tricks

docs.title: Keybinds
docs.text: I highly suggest looking over the keybinds, and resolving the conflicts to prevent the classic "I meant to pet this cow, not mark a waypoint!" conundrum.

docs.title: Figura Ponies
docs.text:
The modpack comes with a few Figura Pony models packed in for your convenience, but there's also a set of templates on the Coney Poney GitHub that you can check out for yourself!

All the officially endorsed complete models are in the Figura Ponies Community Repository.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Here's how you install Maudpack (as well as any modpack via Modrinth) on the following launchers:

docs.title: 1. Prism Launcher (Recommended)
docs.text:
• Click on the "Add Instance" button
  • Go to the "Modrinth" section
  • Search "Maudpack", and install!

docs.title: 2. ATLauncher
docs.text:
• Click on "Packs"
  • Select "Modrinth" on the left
  • Search "Maudpack", and install!

For more information, check out Modrinth's official documentation.

Additionally, if you need help getting the right Java version, check out Prism Launcher's Java install guide.

Launchers such as GDLauncher and the default Minecraft launcher are not supported.

docs.title: JVM Optimization
docs.text:
The JVM (Java Virtual Machine) can be optimized to provide slight performance gains over the default behavior.

While I wouldn't necessarily recommend this if you don't know what you're doing... It may be good for those of you who want to squeeze that extra little bit out of your game.
